title: Boards Moderation Revamp + Visible Moderation now live!
body:
We've heard your frustration regarding slow and, at times, unresponsive moderation on the Oceanic Boards, which is why we're happy to announce that we've made a few changes to moderation over the past few days. With these changes, Boards Volunteers will have moderation abilities and can deal with any reports as appropriate. Volunteers aren't limited to the confines of the standard workday, which allows for faster responses to both posts that are and aren't reported (although your reports will definitely help catch anything that we miss!). Lastly, if you have any questions or comments about moderation, you can post them within the [**Player Behaviour**](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour) sub-boards, or continue to submit your requests via ticket. We'll provide you with as much visibility as possible. 

To kick off the revamped moderation, I've gone through and deleted 18 "Facebook Video" scam links over the past hour and will do another sweep later today. We want to emphasise that you familiarise yourself with the [**Boards Universal Rules**](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BjArMH2B-boards-universal-rules) and report posts that violate these rules. 

Thank you for your patience with this transition, and again, please don't hesitate to post any questions, comments, or concerns.

The new moderators are part of the Riot Games Volunteers Program, which includes the Wrenchmen (Help & Support), Instructors (Gameplay), and Emissaries (Player Behaviour). You can find more information about those programs in their respective sub-boards.
